edu.rmit.eres.seaports.controller

Class ConcreteAuthentication

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.security.authentication.AbstractAuthenticationToken
      • edu.rmit.eres.seaports.controller.ConcreteAuthentication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.security.Principal, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication, org.springframework.security.core.CredentialsContainer

    public class ConcreteAuthentication
extends org.springframework.security.authentication.AbstractAuthenticationToken
    Class used to emulate an authentication with Spring Security in order to be able to run some test cases as different user profiles.
    Author:
    Guillaume Prevost
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
